name: RenderFigmaImages
description:
Fetch rendered images from Figma files by node IDs.

Use this tool to render and retrieve images from a Figma file by specifying node IDs. The tool returns a mapping of node IDs to URLs of the rendered images. Note: Some entries may be null if rendering fails for certain nodes. Images expire after 30 days.

parameters.name: node_ids_to_render
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs for images to be rendered.

value_schema.description: A comma separated list of node IDs to render.

parameters.name: figma_file_key
parameters.description: The key for the Figma file or branch to export images from. Use with the `branch_data` query parameter to obtain branch key if needed.

value_schema.description: File to export images from. This can be a file key or branch key. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param to get the branch key.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: Specify a version ID to retrieve a particular version of a Figma file. If omitted, will use the current version.

value_schema.description: A specific version ID to get. Omitting this will get the current version of the file.

parameters.name: image_scale_factor
parameters.description: A number between 0.01 and 4, representing the image scaling factor for rendering.

value_schema.description: A number between 0.01 and 4, the image scaling factor.

parameters.name: image_output_format
parameters.description: Specify the image format for the output. Options are 'jpg', 'png', 'svg', or 'pdf'.

value_schema.description: A string enum for the image output format.

parameters.name: render_text_as_outlines
parameters.description: Determines if text elements are rendered as outlines in SVGs. Set `true` for visual consistency; `false` for selectable text.

value_schema.description:
Whether text elements are rendered as outlines (vector paths) or as `<text>` elements in SVGs.

Rendering text elements as outlines guarantees that the text looks exactly the same in the SVG as it does in the browser/inside Figma.

Exporting as `<text>` allows text to be selectable inside SVGs and generally makes the SVG easier to read. However, this relies on the browser's rendering engine which can vary between browsers and/or operating systems. As such, visual accuracy is not guaranteed as the result could look different than in Figma.

parameters.name: include_svg_id_attributes
parameters.description: Include id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the layer name to the 'id' attribute.

value_schema.description: Whether to include id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the layer name to the `id` attribute of an svg element.

parameters.name: include_node_id_in_svg_elements
parameters.description: Set to true to include node ID attributes for all SVG elements, adding the node ID to a `data-node-id` attribute.

value_schema.description: Whether to include node id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the node id to a `data-node-id` attribute of an svg element.

parameters.name: svg_stroke_simplification_enabled
parameters.description: Set to true to simplify inside/outside strokes in SVG using stroke attributes instead of `<mask>`.

value_schema.description: Whether to simplify inside/outside strokes and use stroke attribute if possible instead of `<mask>`.

parameters.name: exclude_overlapping_content
parameters.description: Set to true to exclude overlapping content from rendering. Set to false to include overlaps, which may increase processing time.

value_schema.description: Whether content that overlaps the node should be excluded from rendering. Passing false (i.e., rendering overlaps) may increase processing time, since more of the document must be included in rendering.

parameters.name: use_full_dimensions_without_cropping
parameters.description: Export using full node dimensions, ignoring cropping and empty space. Ensures text nodes are fully visible.

value_schema.description: Use the full dimensions of the node regardless of whether or not it is cropped or the space around it is empty. Use this to export text nodes without cropping.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the figma API.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of node IDs to render.

value_schema.description: A comma separated list of node IDs to render.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: A specific version ID to get. Omitting this will get the current version of the file.

value_schema.description: A specific version ID to get. Omitting this will get the current version of the file.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: A number between 0.01 and 4, the image scaling factor.

value_schema.description: A number between 0.01 and 4, the image scaling factor.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A string enum for the image output format.

value_schema.description: A string enum for the image output format.

parameters.name: svg_outline_text
parameters.description:
Whether text elements are rendered as outlines (vector paths) or as `<text>` elements in SVGs.

Rendering text elements as outlines guarantees that the text looks exactly the same in the SVG as it does in the browser/inside Figma.

Exporting as `<text>` allows text to be selectable inside SVGs and generally makes the SVG easier to read. However, this relies on the browser's rendering engine which can vary between browsers and/or operating systems. As such, visual accuracy is not guaranteed as the result could look different than in Figma.

value_schema.description:

Rendering text elements as outlines guarantees that the text looks exactly the same in the SVG as it does in the browser/inside Figma.

Exporting as `<text>` allows text to be selectable inside SVGs and generally makes the SVG easier to read. parameters.name: svg_include_id
parameters.description: Whether to include id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the layer name to the `id` attribute of an svg element.

value_schema.description: Whether to include id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the layer name to the `id` attribute of an svg element.

parameters.name: svg_include_node_id
parameters.description: Whether to include node id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the node id to a `data-node-id` attribute of an svg element.

value_schema.description: Whether to include node id attributes for all SVG elements. Adds the node id to a `data-node-id` attribute of an svg element.

parameters.name: svg_simplify_stroke
parameters.description: Whether to simplify inside/outside strokes and use stroke attribute if possible instead of `<mask>`.

value_schema.description: Whether to simplify inside/outside strokes and use stroke attribute if possible instead of `<mask>`.

parameters.name: contents_only
parameters.description: Whether content that overlaps the node should be excluded from rendering. Passing false (i.e., rendering overlaps) may increase processing time, since more of the document must be included in rendering.

value_schema.description: Whether content that overlaps the node should be excluded from rendering. Passing false (i.e., rendering overlaps) may increase processing time, since more of the document must be included in rendering.

parameters.name: use_absolute_bounds
parameters.description: Use the full dimensions of the node regardless of whether or not it is cropped or the space around it is empty. Use this to export text nodes without cropping.

value_schema.description: Use the full dimensions of the node regardless of whether or not it is cropped or the space around it is empty. Use this to export text nodes without cropping.

parameters.name: file_key
parameters.description: File to export images from. This can be a file key or branch key. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param to get the branch key.

value_schema.description: File to export images from. This can be a file key or branch key. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data` query param to get the branch key.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
